fields.title: Sabzi Polo
fields.content:
Sabzi Polo:

Sabzi polo is a Persian food that comes with rice, herbs, and fish, typically served with fish or chicken.

Ingredients:

  • Basmati rice: 2 cups
  • Fresh herbs: 1 cup each of parsley, cilantro, dill, and chives (chopped)
  • Turmeric: 1 tsp
  • Salt: as it is needed
  • Oil: 2 tbsp

Instructions:

  1. Cook rice: Rinse rice and cook in boiling salted water until 70% done. Drain.
  2. Prepare herbs: Saut√© the chopped herbs in butter/oil for 2-3 minutes.
  3. Mix: Gently mix the herbs into the partially cooked rice.
  4. Steam: Place the rice in a pot, cover, and steam for 30 minutes over low heat.
  5. Serve with fish or any main dish of your choice! Enjoy your flavorful Sabzi Polo!

fields.title: Gheymeh (Persian Beef & Split Pea Stew)
fields.content:
Gheymeh (Persian Beef & Split Pea Stew)

Gheymeh is a comforting Persian stew made with beef, split peas, tomatoes, and dried limes, served with rice.

Ingredients:

  • Beef ‚Äì 500g (cubed)
  • Split peas ‚Äì ¬Ω cup
  • Onion ‚Äì 1, chopped
  • Tomato paste ‚Äì 2 tbsp
  • Dried limes ‚Äì 2 (pierced)
  • Cinnamon ‚Äì 1 tsp
  • Turmeric, salt, pepper ‚Äì to taste
  • Vegetable oil ‚Äì 2 tbsp

Instructions:

  1. Saut√© Onions ‚Äì Heat oil and saut√© onions until golden.
  2. Brown Beef ‚Äì Add beef, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper; brown the meat.
  3. Cook Peas ‚Äì Add split peas, tomato paste, and 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil.
  4. Simmer ‚Äì Add dried limes and let simmer for 1-1.5 hours until meat and peas are tender.
  5. Serve ‚Äì Enjoy with basmati rice for a rich, tangy, and hearty meal! üçõ‚ú®

fields.title: Tahchin (Persian Baked Saffron Rice)
fields.content:
Tahchin (Persian Baked Saffron Rice)

Tahchin is a delicious Persian rice dish made with saffron, yogurt, eggs, and chicken, forming a golden, crispy crust with a soft, flavorful interior.

Ingredients:

  • Basmati rice ‚Äì 2 cups (parboiled, 70% cooked)
  • Chicken ‚Äì 2 breasts (cooked & shredded)
  • Yogurt ‚Äì 1 cup
  • Eggs ‚Äì 2
  • Saffron ‚Äì a pinch (dissolved in warm water)
  • Turmeric ‚Äì 1 tsp
  • Salt & pepper ‚Äì to taste
  • Onion ‚Äì 1 (saut√©ed)
  • Butter/oil ‚Äì for greasing & drizzling
  • Garnish (optional) ‚Äì pistachios, almonds, barberries

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the Rice ‚Äì Rinse and cook rice until 70% done, then drain.
  2. Cook the Chicken ‚Äì Shred after cooking.
  3. Mix Ingredients ‚Äì Whisk yogurt, eggs, saffron, turmeric, salt, pepper, and saut√©ed onions. Add rice and chicken, mixing well.
  4. Assemble ‚Äì Grease a baking dish, press the mixture in evenly, and drizzle with butter/oil.
  5. Bake ‚Äì Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) and bake for 60-70 minutes until golden and crispy.
  6. Serve ‚Äì Flip onto a platter and garnish with saffron, pistachios, almonds, and barberries.

Enjoy your crispy, aromatic Tahchin with a side of yogurt or salad! üçö‚ú®
fields.excerpt: Tahchin is a delicious Persian rice dish made with saffron, yogurt, eggs, and chicken, forming a golden, crispy crust with a soft, flavorful interior.

fields.title: Koobideh Kebab (Persian Grilled Kebab)
fields.content:
Koobideh Kebab (Persian Grilled Kebab)

Koobideh Kebab is a popular Persian dish made from seasoned ground meat, grilled on skewers to perfection. It‚Äôs juicy, flavorful, and best served with basmati rice, grilled vegetables, and yogurt.

Ingredients:

For the Kebab:

  • 500g ground beef or lamb (or a mix)
  • 1 large onion, grated (excess moisture removed)
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced (optional)
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • ¬Ω tsp black pepper
  • ¬Ω tsp cumin (optional)
  • Salt to taste
  • Pinch of saffron in 2 tbsp warm water (optional)
  • Oil for brushing
  • Sumac for garnish (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the Kebab Mixture: Mix ground meat, grated onion, garlic, and spices in a bowl. Knead for 5-10 minutes until sticky. Chill for 30 minutes to firm up.
  2. Shape the Kebab: Lightly oil metal skewers or soak wooden ones. Take a handful of the meat mixture and mold it into a long, even shape around the skewer. Press tightly to prevent breaking.
  3. Grill the Koobideh: Preheat a grill or stovetop grill pan to medium-high heat. Grill for 5-7 minutes per side, brushing with oil or butter for extra flavor.
  4. Serve: Remove from skewers, garnish with sumac, and serve with rice, grilled vegetables, and yogurt.

Tips:

  • Use meat with some fat (80% lean) for juicier kebabs and ensure the grill is hot before cooking.

Enjoy this Persian favorite with family and friends! üç¢üî•

fields.title: Zereshk Polo ba Morgh
fields.content:
Zereshk Polo ba Morgh (Persian Barberry Rice with Chicken)

Ingredients:

For the Chicken:

  • 4 pieces chicken (drumsticks or thighs)
  • 1 large onion, sliced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • A pinch of saffron (dissolved in 2 tbsp warm water)
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • Vegetable oil for frying

For the Rice:

  • 2 cups basmati rice
  • ¬Ω cup barberries (zereshk)
  • 2 tbsp butter
  • A pinch of saffron (dissolved in 2 tbsp warm water)
  • Salt to taste
  • 1 tsp sugar (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Cook the Chicken: Marinate chicken with turmeric, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and saffron water for 30 minutes. Saut√© onions in oil until golden, add chicken, and brown on both sides. Add 1 cup water, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes until tender.
  2. Prepare the Rice: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Boil water with salt, add rice, and cook until 70% done. Drain. In a non-stick pot, add butter, layer rice, and steam on low heat for 20-30 minutes to form a crispy tahdig.
  3. Prepare the Zereshk: Saut√© barberries in butter for 2-3 minutes, adding sugar if desired.
  4. Serve: Mix barberries into the rice or use as a garnish. Serve with chicken and a side of yogurt or Shirazi salad.

Enjoy this flavorful Persian dish! üçõ
fields.excerpt: Zereshk Polo ba Morgh is a delicious Persian dish featuring saffron-infused rice with tangy barberries and tender chicken, perfect for a flavorful meal.

fields.title: Ghorme Sabzi (Persian Herb Stew)
fields.content:
Ghorme Sabzi (Persian Herb Stew)

Ghorme Sabzi is a classic Persian stew known for its deep, aromatic flavors. It combines slow-cooked meat, a medley of fresh herbs, and dried limes for a tangy kick. Served with steamed basmati rice, this dish is a staple of Persian cuisine, loved for its rich taste and comforting warmth.

Ingredients:

For the Stew:

  • 500g lamb or beef (cubed)
  • 1 large onion, chopped
  • 3-4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 dried limes (or ¬º cup fresh lime juice)
  • 1 cup cooked/canned kidney beans (optional)
  • 4-5 cups water or broth

Instructions:

Simmer Stew:

  1. Add saut√©ed herbs to the pot.
  2. Pierce dried limes and add them (or use fresh lime juice later).
  3. Pour in water/broth to cover, bring to a boil, then simmer for 1.5-2 hours.

Final Touch:

  1. Add kidney beans (if using) 30 minutes before serving.
  2. Adjust seasoning and add fresh lime juice if needed.

Serve:

Enjoy hot with steamed basmati rice.
fields.excerpt: Ghorme Sabzi is a rich, aromatic Persian stew with slow-cooked meat, fresh herbs, and a tangy kick from dried limes. It's the perfect dish for a comforting meal.
